dismissalText.commentary: Javed Omar run out (Khan) 80 (117b 7x4 2x6 165m) SR: 68.37

dismissalComment.html: Lazy running, may be tired, from Omar. On the middle stump line, he had attempted a slog sweep, got a edge and it ballooned towards long off. Landed in no man's land in front of Zaheer Khan. Omar turns for second run and ambles down the track. Zaheer fires in a direct hit which catches Omar short of the crease. Omar made a valuable 80.

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan st †Dhoni b Mongia 50 (68b 2x4 0x6 90m) SR: 73.52

dismissalComment.html: beaten in the flight and stumped. Flighted delivery on the off stump and Saqibul jumped down the track,  had a swing and got a inside-edge and it rolled past the stumps to Dhoni who whipped the bails off. It was referred upstairs and the verdict is .... OUT

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Ashraful player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Ashraful perishes going for the runs. He skipped down the track  and tried to swing a delivery on the middle stump  line over to the on side, ball beat the bat and met the sticks.

headshotImage.caption: Habibul Bashar player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Habibul Bashar player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Powar gets rid of Bashar. Done in by the flight and the dip. He tossed it up beautifully, above the eye-level, outside off stump, Bashar comes down the track but the ball dips rapidly, turns and beats the intended lofted shot. Makes contact with the inside half of the bat, much like how Tamim fell, and gently loops up to mid on. Bashar's miserable run with the bat continues.

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Rafique player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Rafique player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Rafique falls off the last ball of the innings. He ran down the track and swung a low full toss down the throat of long off. Bangladesh end up with a very healthy 250.

headshotImage.caption: Rahul Dravid player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rahul Dravid player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Gone! Flighted delivery, outside off, Dravid leant forward, little late in doing so, the balance went awry and he went for a square-drive but was not to the pitch and ended up slicing it straight to backward point. Dravid gone for 22 and India slip further. Typical left-arm spinner's wicket on a slow track.

Mongia is gone! Fifth wicket is down and Bangladesh are truly on top. Flighted delivery sucked Mongia into coming down the track but he couldn't reach the pitch and flicked aerialy low to midwicket. It will all hinge on Dhoni now to steer India to safety and he is fortunate to have an able partner in Karthik

headshotImage.caption: Gautam Gambhir player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Gautam Gambhir player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Got him! Plumb. It landed on a length, on the off stump line, came in and Gambhir placed his front leg across, a touch too across, and had to play around the pad. No wood on leather and he was caught dead in front. Bangladesh strike. Who will come out to bat now?

headshotImage.caption: Virender Sehwag player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Virender Sehwag player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Saqibul takes a beauty at cover. Rasel deceived Sehwag with a slower one. Fullish, on the middle and off and Sehwag again wanted to go inside out over cover, is beaten by the lack of pace and still went through with the shot. It went in the air and appeared as if it would fall short of cover but Saqibul threw himself forward and plucked the ball inches off the turf.

dismissalText.long: c Abdur Razzak b Shahadat Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Yuvraj Singh c Abdur Razzak b Shahadat Hossain 1 (9b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 11.11

dismissalComment.html: Caught at short cover. It was full in length, outside off stump, stops on Yuvraj a touch and he is into his drive early. He tries to adjust by taking the bottom-hand off the handle but still can't keep the ball down. They had it perfectly planned. Slow track, the ball will hold up a touch, give him full-pitched stuff, make him drive, have a short cover and just wait for the mistake.

commentPreTextItems.html: Everybody in the Indian dressing room are up on their feet. Vengsarkar is also seen there.

commentTextItems.html: India have won. By 5 wickets. Fullish, on the middle stump line, Dhoni leans forward and heaves it over midwicket. Camera pans to dressing room. Shastri and Vengsarkar shake hands. The other players are seen clapping.

commentPostTextItems.html: Powered by a calm 107-run partnership between Mahendra Singh Dhoni and Dinesh Karthik, who tackled the spinners well, India won by five wickets.

When five wickets were down, the advantage lay with Bangladesh. The spinners were operating, the wicket had got slower. The odds were stacked against India but Dhoni, hobbling with hamstring injury and running with a bye-runner, and Karthik took control. Karthik swept while Dhoni punched his way and slowly the tables turned. Bashar ran out of ideas, the spinners, seemingly,  lost the bite as the duo milked them.
The players from both teams shake hands, Robin Singh is also there. So is Ravi Shastri. India lead the three-match series 1- 0.

commentTextItems.html: slower offcutter, on the off stump line, Karthik leans forward, waits, opens the bat-face, guides to backward point. Just one run left. Dhoni on strike
fullish, on the leg side and Karthik leans on to it and swings it to long leg boundary. Stylishly picked up.
another single with a punch to long off
leans forward to pat a length-delivery towards mid-off for a easy single. 7 to win. 100 of the partnership up. What a gem it has been. Two busy wicketkeeper-batsmen doing it for India.

Easy. Fifty up in style. Very valuable knock. Low full-toss, on the stumps and he knifes through the line. Yuvraj, the bye runner for Dhoni, congratulates him. Then Dhoni hobbles over and hugs Karthik.
outside off stump, steered to backward point

commentPostTextItems.html: Looking at the way the wicketkeeper-batsmen are performing, may be India should pick more of them!

commentTextItems.html: outside off stump, fullish, Dhoni reaches out, swats it away past point
flighted up, outside off stump, Dhoni eases forward, drives uppishly but he places it well, to left of long off
tossed-up on the middle stump line, pushed to cover
on the middle stump line, Karthik waits for the ball to turn,  not much spin and dabs it to midwicket region
quickish off spin, outside off stump, Karthik late-uts to short third man. Yuvraj thinks there is a run in it and charges down the track, is sent back and reaches in time.
outside leg stump and Karthik is quick to play his sweep shot. He has used that shot really effectively today.

commentTextItems.html: on the middle stump line, driven to cover

commentPreTextItems.html: The two keepers have played purrfectly so far. Picking singles and when the opportunity came along, they went for a boundary.

commentTextItems.html: Slightly short in length , outside off stump and Dhoni stays back and forces it to widish long off. Amazing power from back foot.  He just punched that.
fullish, outside off stump, Karthik eases forward, drives through extra cover and comes back for two. India inch closer. 25 runs now. 24 balls left.

dismissalText.commentary: Habibul Bashar c Gambhir b Powar 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Powar gets rid of Bashar. Done in by the flight and the dip. He tossed it up beautifully, above the eye-level, outside off stump, Bashar comes down the track but the ball dips rapidly, turns and beats the intended lofted shot. Makes contact with the inside half of the bat, much like how Tamim fell, and gently loops up to mid on. Bashar's miserable run with the bat continues.

dismissalText.commentary: Javed Omar run out (Khan) 80 (117b 7x4 2x6 165m) SR: 68.37

dismissalComment.html: Lazy running, may be tired, from Omar. On the middle stump line, he had attempted a slog sweep, got a edge and it ballooned towards long off. Landed in no man's land in front of Zaheer Khan. Omar turns for second run and ambles down the track. Zaheer fires in a direct hit which catches Omar short of the crease. Omar made a valuable 80.

dismissalText.long: c Shakib Al Hasan b Syed Rasel
dismissalText.commentary: Virender Sehwag c Shakib Al Hasan b Syed Rasel 30 (21b 7x4 0x6 38m) SR: 142.85

dismissalComment.html: Saqibul takes a beauty at cover. Rasel deceived Sehwag with a slower one. Fullish, on the middle and off and Sehwag again wanted to go inside out over cover, is beaten by the lack of pace and still went through with the shot. It went in the air and appeared as if it would fall short of cover but Saqibul threw himself forward and plucked the ball inches off the turf.

dismissalText.long: c Abdur Razzak b Shahadat Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Yuvraj Singh c Abdur Razzak b Shahadat Hossain 1 (9b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 11.11

dismissalComment.html: Caught at short cover. It was full in length, outside off stump, stops on Yuvraj a touch and he is into his drive early. He tries to adjust by taking the bottom-hand off the handle but still can't keep the ball down. They had it perfectly planned. Slow track, the ball will hold up a touch, give him full-pitched stuff, make him drive, have a short cover and just wait for the mistake.

dismissalText.long: c Abdur Razzak b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Rahul Dravid c Abdur Razzak b Shakib Al Hasan 22 (39b 2x4 0x6 48m) SR: 56.41

dismissalComment.html: Gone! Flighted delivery, outside off, Dravid leant forward, little late in doing so, the balance went awry and he went for a square-drive but was not to the pitch and ended up slicing it straight to backward point. Dravid gone for 22 and India slip further. Typical left-arm spinner's wicket on a slow track.

dismissalText.long: c Abdur Razzak b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Rahul Dravid c Abdur Razzak b Shakib Al Hasan 22 (39b 2x4 0x6 48m) SR: 56.41

dismissalComment.html: Gone! Flighted delivery, outside off, Dravid leant forward, little late in doing so, the balance went awry and he went for a square-drive but was not to the pitch and ended up slicing it straight to backward point. Dravid gone for 22 and India slip further. Typical left-arm spinner's wicket on a slow track.

dismissalText.long: c Aftab Ahmed b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Dinesh Mongia c Aftab Ahmed b Shakib Al Hasan 17 (25b 2x4 0x6 29m) SR: 68

dismissalComment.html: Mongia is gone! Fifth wicket is down and Bangladesh are truly on top. Flighted delivery sucked Mongia into coming down the track but he couldn't reach the pitch and flicked aerialy low to midwicket. It will all hinge on Dhoni now to steer India to safety and he is fortunate to have an able partner in Karthik

stories.title: Sloppiness taints India win
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v India, 1st ODI, Mirpur
stories.summary: Though India beat Bangladesh, the win was marred by sloppiness in the field, in sapping conditions. It is a series being played at the wrong time, in the wrong place, argues Sidharth Monga
